Vocabularies.Definition: n. a part quoted from a larger written or spoken work 选段，摘录
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  I've seen a short excerpt from the film on television.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. an organization that gives out money for certain special purposes 基金会
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The Gulbenkian Foundation gives money to help artists.

Vocabularies.Definition: become accepted for membership or chosen for office 被接受或录用
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  He took the entrance exam but didn't get in.

Vocabularies.Definition: take from a person or place 带走
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Two chicken curries and rice to take away.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. a small piece or bit 小块，少许
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Give the scraps to the dog.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt.  twist or turn suddenly and forcibly 猛扭，猛拉
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  He managed to wrench himself free.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. 商标，牌子
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  What brand of soap do you like?

Vocabularies.Definition: vt.    fill (time, space, etc.) 占据（时间、地点等）
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Her time is fully occupied with her three children.

Vocabularies.Definition: a.  on the outside 在外的，外面的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The outer walls of the house were made of brick.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. 行政（部门）；管理
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Opposite the clinic is the administration building.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt.  make (a special shape) by cutting 雕刻
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The talented artist carved an interesting decoration from a piece of tree root.

Vocabularies.Definition: vi.   wind into a series of circles 盘绕
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The snake coiled round the tree.

Vocabularies.Definition: a.   very complicated 复杂的，错综的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  He is reading a novel with an intricate plot.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. a feeling about sb. or sth. 印象
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  What were your first impressions of London?

Vocabularies.Definition: advance towards; attack 向…走来；袭击
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   She came at me with a rolling-pin.

Vocabularies.Definition: vi.   shake 颤抖，抖动
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The leaves quivered in the breeze.

Vocabularies.Definition: v.  say (words) aloud for sb. else to write down 口述而由别人记录
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The French teacher dictates to the class every other week.

Vocabularies.Definition: a. kind, gentle 仁慈的，和蔼的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  They are a more benign audience.

Vocabularies.Definition: employ 雇用
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  She was taken on as a graduate trainee.

Vocabularies.Definition: praise in order to recommend, etc. 为（某人）说情，帮（某人）说话
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  I hope you get the job. I'll put in a word for you.
